lines.content: As part of `A-AiAssisted`, I used GitHub CoPilot to help me with code suggestions for implementing the increment `A-BetterGui`. I opened up the chat and asked it to make my GUI look nicer, and then iterated upon the result by asking for specific changes (e.g. to add lines between DialogBoxes).
This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the sea creature _Clam_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Launcher.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Launcher.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something the GUI window show up.

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

Clam is a personal task manager for anyone to use! It's designed to help you keep track of your tasks and deadlines in a simple and efficient way.
- Manage tasks in three categories: ToDo, Deadline, Event
- Find tasks based on a provided search query
- Save your tasks to a local file
Shows a message explaining the commands that can be used in Clam.
Lists all the tasks in your task list.
Adds a todo task to your task list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Adds a deadline task to your task list.
`[due date]` should be in the format `YYYY-MM-DD` (e.g., `2023-12-31`).
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Adds an event task to your task list.
`[start date]` and `[end date]` should be in the format `YYYY-MM-DD` (e.g., `2023-12-31`).
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Marks a task as done or undone using the index provided.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Finds tasks that match the provided search query. The result will be displayed as a list. The search is case-sensitive.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:

Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
* The main class for the Clam.Clam chatbot program, which consists of the {@link TaskList} task list,,
* {@link Storage} save file I/O and {@link Ui} user interface.
* This class initialises all components upon construction, and its {@code main()} method
* starts the program, with the filepath defined to be "./save.txt".
* Constructs a {@link Clam} object with the specified filepath.
* If no file is found at the specified filepath, it will create a new
* file at the specified filepath to work with.
* @param filepath the filepath for the .txt file that this {@code Clam.Clam}
*                 object will run the program with.
* Returns the string text to be printed upon initialisation of the Clam GUI,
* which includes any error messages in regards to the loading of the save file.
* @return greeting string and relevant error message(s), if any
sb.append("Hi! I'm Clam, your personal task manager :)");
sb.append("\n\nIt seems like your task list is brand new! if you're a new user, try running \"help\" to" +
sb.append("\nIt seems there's an error with loading the save file :(");
* A function that facilitates the I/O of the user input and chatbot response output for the GUI,
* retrieving the string from the {@link Ui} object and providing it to the GUI for display.
* @param input the user input from the GUI
* @return the corresponding output that is generated by Clam
* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
private final Clam c = new Clam("./save.txt");
* Sets up the stage and runs the JavaFX application.
* @param stage the stage for the application
* Displays the user's chat with Clam via {@link DialogBox}s. The user input is retrieved from the text box
* and a response is obtained from the {@link Clam} object, which is then displayed in the GUI.
* Gets the relevant message from initialising the {@link Clam} object and displays it in the GUI dialog.
* Represents an executable command in the Clam.Clam chatbot program.
* Each possible command in the program will be defined in a class that
* extends this abstract class, implementing the {@link #execute(TaskList, Ui, Storage)}
* Constructs a {@link Command} with the relevant user input.
* @param input the raw user input that triggered the command
* Executes the relevant command with the given {@link TaskList}, {@link Ui}
* @param tasklist the {@link TaskList} where tasks are stored
* @param ui the {@link Ui} that the user interacts with
* @param storage the {@link Storage} that retrieves and updates the save file
* @throws Exception if any errors occur during the execution of the command
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasklist, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws Exception;
* Returns the help message associated with the command
* Represents the command to add a {@link Deadline} task to the task list.
* Constructs a {@link DeadlineCommand} with the relevant user input.
* @param input the raw user input that triggered the command
* Executes the deadline command: adds a {@link Deadline} to the task list,
* displays a success/failure message and updates the save file accordingly.
* @param tasklist the {@link TaskList} where tasks are stored
* @param ui       the {@link Ui} that the user interacts with
* @param storage  the {@link Storage} that retrieves and updates the save file
* @throws DeadlineException if there is an invalid input
* @throws IOException if there is an error with updating the save file
public void execute(TaskList tasklist, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DeadlineException, IOException {
ui.chatbotPrint("Got it. I've added this task:\n      " + td);
ui.chatbotPrint("Now you have " + tasklist.size() + " tasks in the list.");
throw new DeadlineException("To create a new deadline item, the command is: deadline /by [due date (yyyy-mm-dd)]");
* Returns the help message associated with the deadline command
adds a deadline task to the task list. deadlines have a due date.
* Represents the command to delete a task from the task list.

* Executes the delete command: deletes a task from the task list,
* displays a success/failure message and updates the save file accordingly.

* @param storage  the {@link Storage} that retrieves and updates the save file

* @throws IOException if there is an error with updating the save file
public void execute(TaskList tasklist, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DeleteException, IOException {
ui.chatbotPrint("Now you have " + tasklist.size() + " tasks in the list.");
throw new DeleteException("I'm not sure which item you're trying to delete. Try again?");

marks a task as undone. nothing will happen if the task is already marked as undone.

* A utility class for parsing user input and returning the
* corresponding {@link Command} object or {@link ClamAction} enum value.
* Parses a string as user input and returns a {@link Command} object.
* The code returns a {@link Command} based on the first keyword in the
* input string (separated by space). The resulting {@link Command} is
* initialised with the input for its own use during its execution.
* @return the {@link Command} corresponding to the input
* Parses a string as user input and returns a {@link ClamAction} enum value.
* The code returns a {@link ClamAction} enum value based on the first keyword in the
* input string (separated by space). The resulting {@link ClamAction} enum value
* can be used to run command-specific logic.
* @return the {@link ClamAction} enum value corresponding to the input
* A utility class for loading and writing data to a save file.
* The task list data is saved in a plaintext format on a .txt file
* Constructs a {@link Storage} object with a specified filepath.
* @param filepath the filepath for the .txt file that this {@code Storage}
*                 object will read and write from
* Loads the plaintext data from the file at the specified filepath.
* Returns an empty {@link TaskList} if the file at the specified filepath
* does not exist. Otherwise, the save file will be read line by line,
* each line corresponding to one task, and added to the {@link TaskList}.
* The {@link TaskList} will be returned when all lines in the save file
* If any lines of the save file cannot be loaded properly, the line will
* be added to an error stack and thrown with an exception.
* @return a {@link TaskList} object with the corresponding tasks based
* @throws Exception if an error occurs while reading the save file
* Saves the task list data to the plaintext file at the specified filepath.
* The save file text is generated by writing one line per task in the {@link TaskList},
* with key data separated by the character "|" in a delimited fashion. The first value
* is the task type ({@code todo}/{@code deadline}/{@code event}), the second value is whether that task is marked
* or unmarked (denoted in binary fashion, {@code 0}/{@code 1}), the third value is the description (i.e
* the title of the task), and subsequent values represent extra information for {@code deadline}
* @param tasklist the task list to save to the file at the specified filepath
* @throws IOException if an error occurs with while attempting to write to the file
public void saveToFile(TaskList tasklist) throws IOException {
* An enumeration to represent different possible commands that can be run
* Represents a task with a deadline.
* It has a description (inherited from {@link Task}) and a deadline
* Constructs a {@link Deadline} task with the given description and deadline as strings.
* The deadline is parsed into a {@link LocalDate} object.
* @param description the description/title of the {@link Deadline} task
* @param deadline the deadline of the {@link Deadline} task, stored as a {@link LocalDate}
* Represents a task that occurs within a time period.
* It has a description (inherited from {@link Task}}, a start date (denoted as {@code from})
* and an end date (denoted as {@code to}), the latter two of which are stored as {@link LocalDate}
* Constructs an {@link Event} task with the given description, start date and end date as strings.
* The start and end dates are parsed into {@link LocalDate} objects.
* @param description the description/title of the {@link Event} task
* @param from the start date of the {@link Event} task, stored as a {@link LocalDate}
* @param to the end date of the {@link Event} task, stored as a {@link LocalDate}
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {

* that more specific task types can inherit from (such as {@link ToDo},
* Constructs a new {@link Task} object with the given description.
* New tasks are marked as undone.
* @param description the description/title of the task
* Returns a visual text representation of {@code isDone} as a status icon.

* Marks the task as done. Nothing happens if the task is already marked as done.
* Marks the task as undone. Nothing happens if the task is already marked as undone.

* to store task data in the save file.
* @param input the individual lines of text data in the save file, where one line corresponds to
* @throws Exception if an error occurs while trying to load a task

* Prints an (error) message with an "Error:" header.
* Adds the input string to the current chatbot string stack, for the GUI to display at a later point.

*

The StringBuilder is used here so that methods that print multiple lines can have all of their respective
* print lines collated before being sent back to the GUI when it calls for a response.
* @param s the String to be printed
* Returns the current string stored in the {@link StringBuilder} {@code sb} and clears it for the next string
* @return the string stored in the {@code sb}.
assertEquals("couldn't load task: tod homework", e.getMessage());
